meanings.definition: The act of attributing or ascribing something to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: Her attributions of success to hard work inspired others to strive for their goals.
meanings.sent2: The attributions of the team's victory were shared among all the players.
meanings.sent3: His attributions of his cat's mischief to a secret agent plot made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The attributions of the painting's beauty to the artist's emotions added depth to its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The attributions of the mysterious noise to a ghost made the old house even more eerie.

meanings.definition: A quality or characteristic that is attributed to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The kindness she showed was one of her most admirable attributions.
meanings.sent2: The attributions of intelligence to owls have been popular in folklore for centuries.
meanings.sent3: His attribution of superhero powers to his pet hamster made bedtime stories more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The attribution of bravery to the tiny mouse in the fable taught children a valuable lesson.
meanings.sent5: The attribution of wisdom to the ancient tree added a mystical aura to the forest.

meanings.definition: The process of assigning credit or recognition to a particular person or entity.
meanings.sent1: The attributions of success in the project were well-deserved by the hardworking team.
meanings.sent2: In the business world, attributions of achievements are crucial for employee motivation.
meanings.sent3: The humorous attributions of superhero status to the office janitor lightened the mood at work.
meanings.sent4: The attributions of leadership to the young student council president were evident in her actions.
meanings.sent5: The attributions of creativity to the artist were evident in every masterpiece created.
